name: Beef and Vegetable Stir-Fry
description: A quick and nutritious beef stir-fry with fresh vegetables, perfect for a balanced meal.
steps: 1. Thinly slice the beef (200g) into strips. Wash and peel the carrot (100g) and potato (100g), then cut them into thin julienne sticks. Dice the tomato (100g).
2. In a pan, heat 1 tablespoon of oil over medium heat. Add the beef and stir-fry for about 3-4 minutes until browned. Remove and set aside.
3. In the same pan, add the carrot and potato, and stir-fry for about 5 minutes or until slightly tender.
4. Add the diced tomato to the pan and stir well, cooking for another 2 minutes.
5. Push the vegetables to one side of the pan and crack 1 egg into the empty space. Scramble the egg until fully cooked, then mix it with the vegetables.
6. Add the beef back into the pan along with 1 tsp of sugar, mixing everything together. Cook for an additional 2 minutes. Serve hot.

name: Pasta with Tuna and Tomato Sauce
description: A simple and satisfying pasta dish combining protein-rich tuna with a fresh tomato sauce.
steps: 1. Boil a large pot of salted water and add the pasta (200g), cooking according to the package instructions (usually about 8-10 minutes).
2. While the pasta is cooking, wash and dice the tomatoes (200g).
3. In a separate pan, heat 1 tablespoon of olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced tomatoes and cook for 5-7 minutes until they soften and form a sauce.
4. Drain the canned tuna (150g) and add it to the tomato sauce. Mix well and heat for another 2-3 minutes.
5. Once the pasta is cooked, drain it and combine it with the tuna and tomato sauce. Toss well to coat. Serve immediately.

name: Sweetpotato and Apple Bake
description: A delicious and nutritious baked dish combining sweetpotato with juicy apples for a healthy dessert.
steps: 1. Preheat the oven to 190°C (375°F).
2. Peel the sweetpotato (200g) and cut it into thin slices. Wash the apple (1 large), core it, and slice it thinly.
3. In a baking dish, layer the sweetpotato slices and apple slices alternately. Sprinkle 2 tablespoons of sugar evenly over the top.
4. Cover the dish with foil and bake in the preheated oven for 30 minutes.
5. After 30 minutes, remove the foil and bake for an additional 15 minutes, or until the sweetpotato is tender and the top is slightly caramelized.
6. Serve warm as a dessert or snack.

name: Fish and Potato Cakes
description: Crispy fish cakes made with tender potatoes, ideal as a light lunch or snack.
steps: 1. Boil the potato (150g) until tender, about 15-20 minutes. Drain and mash in a bowl.
2. In another bowl, flake the cooked fish (150g) and mix it with the mashed potato.
3. Add 1 egg (1) and 1 teaspoon of sugar to the mixture, and stir until well combined.
4. Form the mixture into small cakes, about 2 inches wide.
5. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a frying pan over medium heat. Fry the fish cakes for about 4-5 minutes on each side until golden and crispy.
6. Serve while hot, optionally with a side salad.

name: Tuna Salad Sandwich
description: A quick and easy sandwich filled with nutritious tuna and fresh vegetables.
steps: 1. Drain the canned tuna (150g) into a bowl.
2. Wash and slice the tomato (1 medium).
3. Hard boil the egg (1) by placing it in a pot of boiling water for about 10 minutes, then cool it under cold water and peel.
4. Chop the boiled egg and add it to the bowl of tuna, mixing well.
5. Spread the tuna-egg mixture onto one slice of bread (2 slices total), adding sliced tomato on top before placing the second slice of bread over.
6. Cut the sandwich in half and serve.

name: Pork and Carrot Stir Fry
description: Savory and vibrant stir-fried pork with fresh carrots, perfect for a filling dinner.
steps: 1. Thinly slice the pork (200g) into strips and wash, peel, and julienne the carrot (100g).
2. Heat 1 tablespoon of oil in a large pan over medium-high heat. Add the pork and stir-fry for about 5-7 minutes until nicely browned.
3. Add the carrot to the pan and cook for another 3-4 minutes, stirring frequently until the carrot is tender.
4. Crack 1 egg directly into the pan and scramble it with the pork and carrots until fully cooked, around 2-3 minutes.
5. Serve immediately as is or with rice or bread.
